@theycallmeshwaz @byauthentik @noealz

The beauty of this space is that we get to build and define what "web3" truly means.

We don't have to wait for a VC-backed walled garden to tell us what it is after they've built it.

We're not only building web3 in public, we've open-sourced it to everyone from day one.

gm to all the creators in this space continuing to build through bear markets. 

You're here for the best reasons, and this space gets better and better because of you.
The most valuable thing in the world is having the time to pursue the things that interest you the most.

When a project "founder" blames "gas" or "MM" or "Etherscan" for minting issues, it's time to exit the project.

Admitting you don't know and will find out is a growth mindset.

Choosing to instead speak with confidence on things that are simply wrong is not acceptable.

I am speculating that one of the many "public sale raffles" from the past month or a non-standard WL registration form could have been the attack vector for the NFT heist which just occurred.

If it wasn't, it's only a matter of time until it becomes one.
@NicoleBehnam Trustless systems don't require trust.

The irrational hatred of NFTs has become an echo chamber of partisans sharing misinformation amongst themselves.

These are the same people who laugh at "the other side" for misinformation.

They don't care, they too embrace anti-intellectualism as long as it's from "their team". https://t.co/9X6EY9Qj3X

Lots of teams in this space are raising millions of dollars off marketing and hype alone.

That's great.

But then they don't execute, or it's clear that they're simply phoning it in.

This is where having the mentorship/guidance of an incubator or experienced operator is key.

The more and more I immerse myself in this space, the more and more I become convinced that vesting schedules and adult supervision/oversight are beyond required for the vast majority of project teams in web3/NFTs.

The liquidity drain this cycle came in the form of low-effort, low-quality 3D projects buying fake followers, fake Discord members, hacked social media accounts with high followers to fake legitimacy, and marketing blasts from @NFT to fake hype.
@nateliason Religion for the Nonreligious
@peer_rich meows.eth

I love buying cool OBJKTs off the Tezos blockchain and I never have any expectation of making a profit from them. It's just a fun, low-priced hobby.

In contrast, most of my acquisitions on Ethereum are for trading purposes (though I have a sizeable collection there too)(

The long-term reality of NFTs isn't new projects that appreciate wildly to BAYC-level prices.

The TAM is just not there to sustain thousands of projects like this.

The endgame is millions of people buying $5-10 collectibles that they're happy to keep or make $5-50 profit from.
